content.html:
Flash Photography


1 Select FLASH FUNCTION SETTING↓ FLASH SETTING
in the ↓ FLASH SETTING menu. The camera will display options for the built-in flash.I.Q. FLASH FUNCTION SETTING MF RED EYE REMOVAL TTL-LOCK MODE LED LIGHT SETTING MASTER SETTING CH SETTING Built-In Flash MY BACK EXIT
Use the built-in flash for additional lighting when shooting
at night or indoors under low light.

This feature can also be accessed via shortcuts (�� 244).

2 Highlight items using the focus stick
(focus lever) and rotate the rear com-
mand dial to change the highlighted
setting (□ 100).



3 Press DISP/BACK to put the changes into effect.

● Depending on the distance to the subject, the lens may cast shadows
in photos taken with the flash.
● The flash will not fire at some settings, for example in panorama
mode or when the electronic shutter is used.
● Choose shutter speeds slower than 1/2000 S when using the flash in
exposure mode S (shutter-priority AE) or manual (M).

In TTL mode, the flash may fire several times with each shot. Do not
move the camera until shooting is complete.
● The flash will not fire if OFF is selected for SOUND & FLASH in the
8 USER SETTING menu.


● Optional lens hoods are not recommended for use with the built-in
flash as they may cast shadows that cause vignetting.


5

Taking
Photographs
99
content.markdown:
# Flash Photography

Use the built-in flash for additional lighting when shooting
at night or indoors under low light.

| 1 Select FLASH FUNCTION SETTING | ↓ FLASH SETTING |
| --- | --- |
| in the ↓ FLASH SETTING menu. The camera will display options for the built-in flash. | I.Q. FLASH FUNCTION SETTING MF RED EYE REMOVAL TTL-LOCK MODE LED LIGHT SETTING MASTER SETTING CH SETTING Built-In Flash MY BACK EXIT |


This feature can also be accessed via shortcuts (�� 244).

- 2 Highlight items using the focus stick
- (focus lever) and rotate the rear com-
- mand dial to change the highlighted
- setting (□ 100).


![image](/image/placeholder)
MODE
BUILT-IN FLASH
TTL ±0 -2.0 +2.0
- · , bu
TTL MODE 钉TL SYNC. FRONT
ZOOM ANGLE
ADJUST BACK END

3 Press DISP/BACK to put the changes into effect.

- ● Depending on the distance to the subject, the lens may cast shadows
- in photos taken with the flash.
- ● The flash will not fire at some settings, for example in panorama
- mode or when the electronic shutter is used.
- ● Choose shutter speeds slower than 1/2000 S when using the flash in
- exposure mode S (shutter-priority AE) or manual (M).


- In TTL mode, the flash may fire several times with each shot. Do not
- move the camera until shooting is complete.
- ● The flash will not fire if OFF is selected for SOUND & FLASH in the
- 8 USER SETTING menu.


● Optional lens hoods are not recommended for use with the built-in
flash as they may cast shadows that cause vignetting.

5

Taking
Photographs
